reviews.review: exelente
i hate this game but i have stockholm syndrome

This is the first game I bought when I started gaming. The controls are pretty easy for a newbie like myself. I've watched my sister play this game which makes me familiar of it. The game matches you with players with the same rank/level as you, sometimes when playing at night it sometimes takes awhile for you to be matched with other players. Prior to the game starting there are tips on  the screen as the game loads, you may read those to understand more of the game even after the tutorial. Get ready to get some adrenaline rushing if you get this game!
obsessed with this game, both being a survivor n a killer is fun and and theres lots of things to do, ways to progress, and many achievements to collect :D

Media hora para buscar partida para que luego te tunelen y campen a muerte si o si a muerte ,la optimizacion es de lo peor ,el juego base ya es bastante caro para lo da que es un completa basura y mas encima nos hinchan con dlc ,osea nos deben tomar el pelo ,incluso el dbd de mobile es un asco ,que se puede esperar de ustedes si lo unico que les intersa es la platita y este "juego" si se le puede decir asi ,esta hecho solo para ustedes ya que ni siquiera piensan en la comunidad ,son un asco ,este juego y ustedes.

Such a fun game to play with friends, solo queue is rough, balancing issues are super prominent and take what feels like ages to fix. Game is literally full of bugs that tend to ruin the fun and excitement majority of them time but also bring laughs as well if you take the game lightly. If you're going to play this game make note now that it is NOT competitive and never will be. If you can be chill and enjoy the game for what it is you'll definitely enjoy it. By far my favorite game of all time despite the downsides.
Matchmaking is trash in this game. If you are planning to buy this, expect to be matched against players with hundreds of hours more than you

fun game. That my review
p;

Genuinely one of the most creatively fun games of all time. It's not only the inventor of its own genre of games (though Identity V is poor in comparison and Friday The 13th: The Game was unfortunately cancelled), it has developers that genuinely seem to care, and even the worst issues in balancing are nowhere near that of any competitive game today. Any complaints that can be made are also being worked on, which is great as well.
9/10.

This game is fun, its just that the developers are so stubborn (In the nicest way possible). They create things for the game that no one asked for, ask the public how they think about it, and even when it gets horrible reviews they'll add it anyway. I love this game, but honestly i'm thinking about quitting. The game has no nostalgia, and i even hate they new survivor movement animations. I just have one request, please bring back the old survivor movement, at least for me. I love this game and i don't want to let it go, so please. And if you do, the community will love the nostalgia, at least i will.

Preciso nem falar o quanto esse game √© esbelto

+
- active community
- high learning curve 
- high replayability

-
- no gameplay updates (besides new characters)
- little to no balancing updates
- outrageous progression system
- frequent problems with matchmaking (disconects, ping, etc.)
- no real ranking system
- a lot of content behind a paywall (dlc's, skins)

All in all a decent time-sink-game if ur not struggling with anger issues. The Devs never thought the game would be this popular and thats exactly how they treat it. Although its not a greedy cashgrab from a tripple A company like most games these days the ammount of care that is put into the maintenance of the game is a joke. Too much work put into new DLC's and cosmetics. Even gamebreaking bugs persist over months or just keep reoccurring pretty much since release. They do address issues but imo its too little too late. Realy sad because theres a potentialy great game in there.
very good, love ranking down to be rewarded with sweaty games and nothing extra in return

[h1]Zarina[/h1]
[i]A story of heartbreak, Deceipt and lazy videogame companies.
Based on true events[/i]

[b][If you only want to know the conclusion, skip to Chapter IV][/b]
[hr][/hr]

[b]Chapter I: It all started with that outfit[/b]


So a while ago, back when I was still playing this game very actively I obtained the battle pass for it and I completed it. Among the unlocked outfits there was one in particular which I really liked. It was an outfit for Zarina Cassir, a character which I have never picked up before.
That was until I saw her in that outfit.

That's where this tragic love story begins.

[hr][/hr]

[b]Chapter II: Bonding[/b]


So I started doing some work. I first played her to prestiege 3. (max. Level)
Easy enough!
Then one by one I started unlocking every single perk in the game on her.
One. By. One...

With every game we've played together I grew closer to her and I kid you not when I'm saying that I never saw anyone else use that particular skin.
Not even once.

The last anniversary was probably the highlight on our journey.
We managed to obtain roughly 140 sacrificial cakes. And that was the day that I officially started calling her my 'main'.
There was no ceremony.
[i]Just me...[/i]
[i]...and her[/i]

She managed to turn me from a cold-hearted killer main into a 'friendly survivor'.

But the tides were about to turn...

[hr][/hr]

[b]Chapter III: I did not understand[/b]


So we come to the present day, where the anniversary has ended about a month ago and a new Battle Pass has made its way to the live servers and I start a game.

So there I was in the lobby and noticed something peculiar.
Someone was using the same Zarina outfit as I did I wasn't bothered at all at first since everyone who also worked their way through the Battle Pass to obtain their outfits through hard work I consider family at this point.
but after I told that other Zarina that I liked her skin, she said the words that changed everything:
"haha, thx. I got it today <3"

"Impossible.", I thought to myself. Still I immediately left the lobby to check for myself. But sure enough.
There she was...
On display. Obtainable for measly 10‚Ç¨.

I was disgusted. Speechless. Heartbroken.
And when I looked into the new battle pass... Now that made me really sick...

There was a 'new' Zarina skin in there.
But it wasn't actually new.
It was a red re-coloring of the very same outfit that I originally fell in love with.

I tried to understand.
Why couldnt they just ship the red version to the store?
Why didn't they just leave the red version in the new battle pass. But without ruining the integrity of my blue one.
I did not understand.

[hr][/hr]

[b]Chapter IV: Bad Behaviour and disappointment[/b]


After unlocking basically everything that is obtainable just by playing the game the more exciting thing to me became collecting exclusive skins.
Everyone makes their own goals. For some it is rank. For some it's achievements and for me it was collecting skins combined with that previously mentioned sense of exclusivity, that kept me engaged after all those hours.

So regardless how petty it might come off to anyone reading this.
This event took all the motivation and passion for this game that I had left away.

I might eventually return to the game and find new goals to work towards but it's little things like these that made me keep losing more and more respect for Behaviour.
They keep making these anti-consumer decisions like there's no tomorrow. And it doesn't even matter, since there isn't really competition with a game like this. People at best will just say something along the lines of "hitboxes bad, servers bad, balancing bad, etc." but end up shrugging it off and sinking in another 3000 hours.

Meanwhile behavior will just go out of their way to be as lazy as they can by just re-releasing old exclusive skins instead of just putting in the effort to come up with new ones heck, a slight redesign to distinguish the different versions would have already been enough for me.

Sadly they just can't be bothered to give two sh*ts about their game...

[hr][/hr]

TL:DR I can't wait to buy the legacy skins for 10‚Ç¨ !
game good

I've been playing this game since July 2017 on PS4 and only until 2020 when I got my PC did I move to PC, so I have well over [u]5k hours[/u] in this game and I can proudly say, I [b]love/hate[/b] this game like many others. The game has had many ups and downs but no matter what I will always return. Any game like that deserves to be recommended. I love this game like a sibling and only want to see the devs do good with it. The devs do tend to be survivor biased and killers will always be annoyed with SWFs groups (Survive with Friends) but once you can get passed it and understand some games are just out of your hands, you'll have more fun. Survivor is by far the more relaxing side as weird as it sounds. Once you get better you will have almost no problem being chased for minutes on end on some maps.

[u]TLDR- It's worth the purchase for sure.[/u]

New Review: Over time they've shown more and more to not give a shit about their killer community and i'm tired of it. They consistently nerf killer sided things that don't need nerfs, don't fix bugs after years of them existing, peddle cosmetics while the game is unplayable, and refuse to ban cheaters while banning the mod community that made better cosmetics than they ever have. BHVR has lost all respect and my faith in them. I don't recommend this game anymore until they stop being biased and fix the issues that have plagued the game for years. Maybe BHVR is the plague...

[u]TLDR- It's not worth the purchase anymore.[/u]
